result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier Rivas II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Javier Rivas II is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Javier Rivas II was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 5 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May have supervised contact per DCFS w/child.  May not possess firearms.  Obey conditions of CHIPS case.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Terry Rose. DCFS Worker Jose Gonzalez appears.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  816 - Report on current CHIPS case given. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 7 years in the WSP; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision - IMPOSED AND STAYED. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. 5 days sentence credit if revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered - to be taken from bond. Any balance may be returned to poster.  Firearms warning, Voters rights, Appeal rights given.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Rose the time of the SEH on 9/23/16 is changed from 10:30am to 8:15am and will take place with Judge Wagner in the Br 7 courtroom.

from Yvonne Goine provided by Atty Rose in Court.

Parties agree to adjourn sentencing pending outcome of the JV case scheduled today and Atty Rose provides a copy of the dispositional report for that case to the court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Terry Rose.  Social worker Jose Gonzales of DHS appeared re CHIPS matter regarding child.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentencing hearing 7/22/16 at 10:45.  Bond continued.

of Bail/Bond Forf.  kmk

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Atty T Rose appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states he received a call from the deft's mother stating he had to go to the hospital, then deft called stating he had to bring wife to hospital, states he advised deft to appear.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $5,000 cash bond.
from Atty T Rose with documentation of deft's admittance to hospital on 6/6/16.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty T. Rose appeared on behalf of the deft, who did not appear.    Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Rose advised that the deft's mom called his office to say that the deft was hospitalized.  SEH adjourned to 6/27/16 @ 1:30.  Deft to produce proof of hospitalization by 5:00 p.m. on 6/10/16 or the court will forfeit bond and issue a warrant $5,000.00 cash bond.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 6/6/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
